name: uncensured
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not censured (= criticized, especially formally): go uncensured The show was utterly unacceptable and cannot be allowed to go uncensured.
More examplesFewer examplesFor lack of evidence, he goes unpunished by the law and uncensured by the community in which he lives. The publisher and editor cannot be allowed to escape uncensured for such a glaring error. She hoped at least to pass uncensured through the crowd.Britain could not stand before the world as the custodian of liberty so long as such deeds went uncensured and unpunished.
